questions.question: What is the main function of a centrifugal pump?

answers.b: To convert pressure energy into kinetic energy
answers.c: To convert mechanical energy into hydraulic energy
answers.d: To measure the flow of fluid

explanations.a: Centrifugal pumps do not compress gases, they pump liquids.
explanations.b: The pump actually converts mechanical energy to pressure energy, not pressure to kinetic.
explanations.c: Correct! The pump converts mechanical energy into hydraulic (pressure) energy.
explanations.d: Measuring flow is done by flow meters, not pumps.

questions.question: Which part of the centrifugal pump imparts energy to the fluid?

explanations.a: The casing directs flow but does not impart energy.
explanations.b: Correct! The impeller imparts kinetic energy to the fluid.
explanations.c: Delivery pipe carries fluid away, no energy addition.
explanations.d: Suction pipe allows fluid entry but doesn’t add energy.

questions.question: Why is priming necessary before starting a centrifugal pump?

answers.c: To fill the pump with water and remove air
answers.d: To increase the pressure in the suction pipe

explanations.a: Priming is not related to motor operation.
explanations.b: Priming does not clean the impeller.
explanations.c: Correct! Priming ensures the pump casing is filled with fluid and air is removed.
explanations.d: Pressure increases due to pump operation, not priming.

questions.question: The efficiency of a centrifugal pump is calculated as:

answers.a: Output power divided by input power
answers.d: Input power divided by output power

explanations.a: Correct! Efficiency is the ratio of useful output power to input power.
explanations.b: This is not efficiency, it’s a meaningless ratio here.
explanations.c: This ratio does not define efficiency.
explanations.d: This is the inverse of efficiency.

questions.question: What happens to the fluid when it passes through the rotating impeller?

answers.b: It moves to the suction pipe

explanations.a: Temperature changes are minimal and not primary function.
explanations.b: Fluid enters through the suction pipe, not moves to it after impeller.
explanations.c: Correct! The impeller increases fluid velocity and pressure.
explanations.d: Fluids are generally incompressible in pumps; pressure increase is due to energy addition, not compression.
